intro: Hutera pseudoerucastrum subsp. setigera, commonly known as the slender hutera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers clustered in racemes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
